## Resources

<br> 

[**<font size="4" color="red">These resources</font>**](http://ohi-science.org/news/Resources-for-R-and-Data-Science) helped us learn open data science practices and tools. They are developed and used by a welcoming, inclusive community and are all available online for free. 

- We also created an [**Introduction to Open Data Science**](http://ohi-science.org/data-science-training) hands-on training book to teach the collaborative, reproducible, open practices we describe in Lowndes et al. 2017.


[**<font size="4" color="red">These references</font>**](http://ohi-science.org/news/importance-of-open-data-science-tools) in the academic literature and media discuss the importance of open data science tools in science.

## Community

#### We are passionate about building the environmental data science community!

<br>

<div class="col2">

<br>

![](figures/nature_graphic_ohi_smith.jpg)

We think that with existing data science tools and open practices, together we can find environmental solutions more efficiently.

We are proud members of the [rOpenSci](https://ropensci.org/), [RStudio](http://rstudio.com/), [R-Ladies](https://rladies.org/), and [#rstats](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23rstats&src=typd) communities. 

You can also check out our skill-sharing and community-building study group: [eco-data-science](http://eco-data-science.github.io/).
